items.text: tapped to cover point off the front foot
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: strays down the pads and flighted but too full. Clipped to fine-leg
items.shortText: de Silva to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: gets the length right that time, and a hint of turn into the right-hander, but its worked away into the covers
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: strays down leg again, gives it some loop, but not much turn. tucked away to square leg
items.shortText: de Silva to Mohammad Mithun, 1 leg bye

items.text: comes on the front foot to work this away to midwicket and pick up a single
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Shout_Out_To_BC: "If (unfortunately) Tamim Iqbal needs to be replaced due to his injury (BTW, any updates on that?), then BCB can consider Mohammad Ashraful to give another crack at the bowlers. God, I would give up a plate of hot, steaming, spicy plate of Chicken Biryani, any day to watch him bat again"
items.text: on target immediately after his back, Lakmal hits a length outside off. Defended into the offside to scamper a single
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Sri Lanka forced to turn to Lakmal when they probably wouldn't have wanted to, with the spinners being taken apart.
items.text: straighter and raps him on the pads but that would have missed legstump comfortably.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 1 leg bye

items.text: overpitched and Mushfiqur goes forward and drives nicely, but straight to the fielder at mid-off
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: DIRECT HIT could be tight. No he's safe. Had strayed down the pads and the batsmen ran through, but the fielder at short midwicket got the stumps direct.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 leg bye

items.text: defended into the off-side
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Lots of people asking about Tamim: He's been taken to the hospital for an x-ray, Sangakkara just confirmed on air.
items.text: inside edge runs away towards square leg. Fortunate for the batsman
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 2 runs

items.preText:
Mohaiminul Isla: "M Mithun always had the talent, but never was he confident in the international arena in the past. The good thing about him this time is his confidence. He is not trembling anymore."

Dhananjaya continues
items.text: tossed up on middle and leg but Mushfiqur steps down and tucks it away towards long-on
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: sticks to that leg-stump line from round the wicket, firing it into the pads and the ball runs away towards fineleg
items.shortText: de Silva to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: Over the sightscreen! Steps out and hits it striaght back
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, SIX runs

items.text: bowled on the pads again, flat, and tries to work it away but can't get past the fielder at short midwicket
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: stays back and swivels it to square-leg.
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: straighter one, still flat. Not much turn. Driven to long-on for a comfortable single
items.shortText: de Silva to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.preText: Mashur: "Uhhh! Such a build-up after that horrible start! Mithun is just winning my heart. Make it a big one tigers! Start the tournament with a win so that the Bangladeshi fans like me get more charge to follow the tournament!!!" - Bangladesh fans should definitely follow the tournament. The team has a good chance of progressing
items.text: rolls into the legside off a thickish inside edge
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: a little bit of movement back into the batsman, but ends up on the pads and is flicked away to square leg
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: draws the edge A well-deserved half-century for Mithun, but it came off a genuine outside edge. In the channel and Mithun had a nibble at it. No slips though and the ball flies to the boundary
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.preText: Ahmed Azmeer: "With the spinners getting hit all over, i think dasun shanka will be the right option at the moment" - Might be a good idea, yes.
items.text: fuller and straighter, tucked away to midwicket
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: digs it in short and on target. Mushfiqur ducks under it
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Shawkat : "The pre-match discussion, including both captains, suggested the pitch was going to be a good batting pitch, but it seems to be slightly sticky (for the pacers at least) and not much movement for spinners. How could everyone read this pitch wrong? " - pitch reading is a very inexact science. More art and science combined I think
items.text: back of a length on off and punched away to point's right
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Haroon Khan: "I think it's safe to say that Bangladesh are officially back in this game " - Most definitely they are.
items.text: strays down leg and clipped to square leg
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: length on off, not much turn. steered towards the left of point
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run
